channel.title: Objects not deleting
channel.description:
I was trying to move an altar in my server and I had the coords but just to make absolute sure I did ::object 6552 (ancient altar) which spawned it in a spot, now when I relogged and was back in game when I tried to walk to that spot where the altar was to choose another position for it I could not walk in that area, and it would force me around it like something was still there.
So I need help figuring this out if it's something to do with the command or how the object is not getting deleted this happens for everything not just this one object.

item.title: Objects not deleting
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:554898”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=673821.msg4505330#msg4505330 date=1456956102]

Ok umm he’s right we need more info however the ::object command is like a temporary object spawn only it should always be gone when you relog.

It’s possible the command is supposed to be creating temporary objects but it’s creating a server object that doesn’t get deleted on relog. The object could get set to an id of 0, which on object type 10 it won’t show as an object, but you still cannot walk on said tile.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("object")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ", 3); int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); c.getPA().object(id, c.absX, c.absY, 0, 10); } catch(Exception e) { } }
[/quote]
What’s the object method look like in your player assistant class?[/quote]

[code]/**
* Objects, add and remove
**/
public void object(int objectId, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int objectType) {
if (c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) {
c.getOutStream().createFrame(85);
c.getOutStream().writeByteC(objectY - (c.getMapRegionY() * 8));
c.getOutStream().writeByteC(objectX - (c.getMapRegionX() * 8));
c.getOutStream().createFrame(101);
c.getOutStream().writeByteC((objectType << 2) + (face & 3));
c.getOutStream().writeByte(0);
if (objectId != -1) { // removing
c.getOutStream().createFrame(151);
c.getOutStream().writeByteS(0);
c.getOutStream().writeWordBigEndian(objectId);
c.getOutStream().writeByteS((objectType << 2) + (face & 3));
}
}
}

public void checkObjectSpawn(int objectId, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int objectType) {
	if (c.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) > 60)
		return;
	if (c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) {
		c.getOutStream().createFrame(85);
		c.getOutStream().writeByteC(objectY - (c.getMapRegionY() * 8));
		c.getOutStream().writeByteC(objectX - (c.getMapRegionX() * 8));
		c.getOutStream().createFrame(101);
		c.getOutStream().writeByteC((objectType << 2) + (face & 3));
		c.getOutStream().writeByte(0);
		if (objectId != -1) { // removing
			c.getOutStream().createFrame(151);
			c.getOutStream().writeByteS(0);
			c.getOutStream().writeWordBigEndian(objectId);
			c.getOutStream().writeByteS((objectType << 2) + (face & 3));
		}
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

“Hey I have a problem with a command, I can’t figure out what’s wrong with it”

Yet you fail to provide the command… You need to supply us with code if your error is stemming from code.
